title: Deere 750 Grain Drill - Half Speed Gear Problems

tasks.task: Adjusting seed cups on a grain drill.
subtasks: Using a lever to adjust the width of the seed cups.
Dealing with seed piling and poor seed flow at lower seeding rates.

tasks.task: Installing gears (half-speed) on a grain drill.
subtasks: Removing the original gear and installing a smaller gear with a pin.
Addressing space constraints to remove and replace gears.
Considering a tool press for easier roll pin removal.
Obtaining compatible gears (Part number needed).
Replacing various wear parts (gauge wheels, seed openers, seed boots).
Preparing the drill for the upcoming planting season (spring).

tasks.task: Experimenting with seeding rates and settings.
subtasks: Fine-tuning the seeding rate during cover crop planting.
Monitoring and adjusting the seeding rate sensitivity.
Ensuring proper seed depth and coverage.
